title: Popular birth control device reviewed
content:
U.S. regulators reviewed a popular birth control implant device at a panel this month following multiple complaints. The FDA on Sept. 24 discussed the safety of the device after numerous women have said they faced debilitating side effects. 
  
The implant, called Essure, was approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration in 2002. The small metal spring is designed to be placed in the fallopian tubes, so that no egg can pass through.
